CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: We report the synthesis , characterization , and solar cell properties of new donor - acceptor - type low band gap polymers ( POBDTPD and PEBDTPD ) that incorporate dialkoxybenzodithiophene ( BDT ) as the donor and N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ) as the acceptor. The newly developed DTPD moiety was carefully designed to lower a band gap via strong interaction between donor - acceptor moieties and keep polymer energy levels deep. Remarkably , the DTPD acceptor moiety effectively widens the light absorption range of the polymers up to ∼ 900 nm while positioning their HOMO and LUMO levels in the optimal range , i.e. , -5.3 and -4.0 eV , respectively , for high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as we intended. Solar cell devices were fabricated according to the structure ITO / PEDOT : PSS / photoactive ( polymer : PC 70 BM ) / TiO 2 / Al. The POBDTPD devices exhibited a PCE of 4.7% with a V oc of 0.70 V , a J sc of 10.6 mA / cm^2 , and a FF of 0.64. The PEBDTPD devices yielded a higher PCE of 5.3% with a V oc of 0.72 V , a J sc of 13.5 mA / cm^2 , and a FF of 0.54. AFM , TEM , and PL quenching measurements revealed that the high J sc s are a result of the appropriate morphology and efficient charge separation. In comparing the performances of the two polymer devices , the higher J sc for the PEBDTPD device was attributed to its better nanoscale phase separation , smoother surface , and higher carrier mobility in the polymer : PC 70 BM blend films. The higher FF for the POBDTPD device was ascribed to a good balance between the hole and electron mobilities. Overall , we demonstrate that the DTPD unit is a promising electron - accepting moiety to develop high performance low band gap polymers . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted great attention for their potential utility in the production of large - area , low - cost , and flexible photovoltaic devices via solution processing. 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes. To meet these requirements , intensive research efforts have been focused on integrating electron - rich donor units and electron - deficient acceptor units into a single conjugated polymeric system.

Let's think step by step.

1. POBDTPD and PEBDTPD (newly developed polymers)
2. Dialkoxybenzodithiophene (BDT)
3. N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione (DTPD)
4. ITO
5. PEDOT : PSS
6. Photoactive (polymer : PC 70 BM)
7. TiO 2
8. Al
9. [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC 60 BM)
10. [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester (PC 70 BM)

| Material Name |
| --- |
| POBDTPD |
| PEBDTPD |
| Dialkoxybenzodithiophene (BDT) |
| N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione (DTPD) |
| ITO |

| Photoactive (polymer : PC 70 BM) |
| TiO 2 |

* ITO
* PEDOT : PSS

These entities refer to materials used in the fabrication of the solar cells or measurement techniques, but they are not the material names of the polymers or fullerenes mentioned in the paragraph.

Paragraph: We report the synthesis , characterization , and solar cell properties of new donor - acceptor - type low band gap polymers ( POBDTPD and PEBDTPD ) that incorporate dialkoxybenzodithiophene ( BDT ) as the donor and N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ) as the acceptor. The newly developed DTPD moiety was carefully designed to lower a band gap via strong interaction between donor - acceptor moieties and keep polymer energy levels deep. Remarkably , the DTPD acceptor moiety effectively widens the light absorption range of the polymers up to ∼ 900 nm while positioning their HOMO and LUMO levels in the optimal range , i.e. , -5.3 and -4.0 eV , respectively , for high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as we intended. Solar cell devices were fabricated according to the structure ITO / PEDOT : PSS / photoactive ( polymer : PC 70 BM ) / TiO 2 / Al. The POBDTPD devices exhibited a PCE of 4.7% with a V oc of 0.70 V , a J sc of 10.6 mA / cm^2 , and a FF of 0.64. The PEBDTPD devices yielded a higher PCE of 5.3% with a V oc of 0.72 V , a J sc of 13.5 mA / cm^2 , and a FF of 0.54. AFM , TEM , and PL quenching measurements revealed that the high J sc s are a result of the appropriate morphology and efficient charge separation. In comparing the performances of the two polymer devices , the higher J sc for the PEBDTPD device was attributed to its better nanoscale phase separation , smoother surface , and higher carrier mobility in the polymer : PC 70 BM blend films. The higher FF for the POBDTPD device was ascribed to a good balance between the hole and electron mobilities. Overall , we demonstrate that the DTPD unit is a promising electron - accepting moiety to develop high performance low band gap polymers . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted great attention for their potential utility in the production of large - area , low - cost , and flexible photovoltaic devices via solution processing. 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes. To meet these requirements , intensive research efforts have been focused on integrating electron - rich donor units and electron - deficient acceptor units into a single conjugated polymeric system.

Let's think step by step.

1. Synthesis and characterization properties of new polymers POBDTPD and PEBDTPD
2. Band gap of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD
3. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) energy level of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD
4. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) energy level of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD
5. Power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD devices
6. Open circuit voltage (V oc) of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD devices
7. Short circuit current density (J sc) of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD devices
8. Fill factor (FF) of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD devices
9. Morphology of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD devices
10. Charge separation efficiency of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD devices
11. Carrier mobility in the polymer : PC 70 BM blend films
12. Desirable characteristics of electron donor polymers for high power conversion efficiencies
13. Solar spectrum
14. Energy level alignment with respect to electron acceptor fullerene derivatives (PC 60 BM or PC 70 BM)
15. Nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer
16. Effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes
17. Intensively researched areas for integrating electron-rich donor units and electron-deficient acceptor units into a single conjugated polymeric system.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: We report the synthesis , characterization , and solar cell properties of new donor - acceptor - type low band gap polymers ( POBDTPD and PEBDTPD ) that incorporate dialkoxybenzodithiophene ( BDT ) as the donor and N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ) as the acceptor. The newly developed DTPD moiety was carefully designed to lower a band gap via strong interaction between donor - acceptor moieties and keep polymer energy levels deep. Remarkably , the DTPD acceptor moiety effectively widens the light absorption range of the polymers up to ∼ 900 nm while positioning their HOMO and LUMO levels in the optimal range , i.e. , -5.3 and -4.0 eV , respectively , for high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as we intended. Solar cell devices were fabricated according to the structure ITO / PEDOT : PSS / photoactive ( polymer : PC 70 BM ) / TiO 2 / Al. The POBDTPD devices exhibited a PCE of 4.7% with a V oc of 0.70 V , a J sc of 10.6 mA / cm^2 , and a FF of 0.64. The PEBDTPD devices yielded a higher PCE of 5.3% with a V oc of 0.72 V , a J sc of 13.5 mA / cm^2 , and a FF of 0.54. AFM , TEM , and PL quenching measurements revealed that the high J sc s are a result of the appropriate morphology and efficient charge separation. In comparing the performances of the two polymer devices , the higher J sc for the PEBDTPD device was attributed to its better nanoscale phase separation , smoother surface , and higher carrier mobility in the polymer : PC 70 BM blend films. The higher FF for the POBDTPD device was ascribed to a good balance between the hole and electron mobilities. Overall , we demonstrate that the DTPD unit is a promising electron - accepting moiety to develop high performance low band gap polymers . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted great attention for their potential utility in the production of large - area , low - cost , and flexible photovoltaic devices via solution processing. 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes. To meet these requirements , intensive research efforts have been focused on integrating electron - rich donor units and electron - deficient acceptor units into a single conjugated polymeric system.

Let's think step by step.

1. Solar cell properties of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers:
   - POBDTPD:
     - HOMO level: -5.3 eV
     - LUMO level: -4.0 eV
     - PCE: 4.7%
     - Voc: 0.70 V
     - Jsc: 10.6 mA / cm^2
     - FF: 0.64
   - PEBDTPD:
     - HOMO level: -5.3 eV
     - LUMO level: -4.0 eV
     - PCE: 5.3%
     - Voc: 0.72 V
     - Jsc: 13.5 mA / cm^2
     - FF: 0.54

2. Desirable characteristics for high power conversion efficiencies in polymer solar cells (PSCs):
   - Electron donor polymers should have:
     - Good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum
     - Optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron acceptor fullerene derivatives (PC 60 BM or PC 70 BM)
     - Formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer
     - Provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes

3. Characterization techniques used:
   - AFM (Atomic Force Microscopy)
   - TEM (Transmission Electron Microscopy)
   - PL quenching measurements

4. Morphology and charge separation in the polymer: PC 70 BM blend films:
   - PEBDTPD device: better nanoscale phase separation, smoother surface, and higher carrier mobility
   - POBDTPD device: good balance between hole and electron mobilities.

5. Electron-rich donor units and electron-deficient acceptor units in a single conjugated polymeric system:
   - Intensive research efforts have been focused on this area to achieve high power conversion efficiencies in PSCs.
